abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Conakry Urban
            Development Project for Guinea was satisfactory. The project
            achieved its main objectives, its impact on institutional
            development was significant, sustainability is likely, and
            the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, although the choice of not creating an
            autonomous project unit proved to beneficial to internalize
            policy reform, perhaps it was a mistake not to have
            strengthened the project management unit with outside
            support familiar with Bank procedures. Second, for
            critically lacking financial and administrative skills, it
            would probably have been cost effective to provide for more
            than the strict minimum in training. Third, the project
            proved instrumental in strengthening urban institutions and
            assisting the Guinean government in putting in place a
            completely new structure for local government in less than
            six years. Fourth, the development of more self-reliant
            financing mechanisms for the provision of urban services
            remains one of the critical challenges for the efficiency of
            the sector in the future. Fifth, the project restructuring,
            adding an employment generation objective, allowed for an
            adjustment of the institutional arrangements to the
            country's political and administrative changes.
            Finally, close coordination between MUH, CECI, and UNEG
            proved instrumental in designing an assistance program
            responsive to the needs of small enterprises.

repnme.cdata!: Guinea - Conakry urban development plan : summary

abstracts.cdata!:
This paper states that the Conakry urban
            development plan results from the articulation of several
            policies: space, land, equipment, housing, financial and
            institutional. There were a number of draft proposals which
            will allow the government to engage in urban development
            with a balanced policy. The implementation of the
            recommendations requires a strong willingness on the part of
            officials, a coherent coordination of effort and a lot of continuity.

0.cdata!:
Guinée - Plan de développement urbain de
            Conakry : résumé

abstracts.cdata!:
The Conakry Urban Development Project
            will strengthen the operational capacity of Central and
            Local Government institutions responsible for urban
            development planning and urban service management in
            Conakry. To this effect, the project will fund: (i)
            technical assistance, training and provision of essential
            equipment to enhance The Ministry of Construction, Housing,
            Urban Planning and Domain (MCHUD)'s and the Conakry
            Administrative Region (RAC)'s capacity to plan,
            coordinate and control urban development in the Greater
            Conakry area; (ii) technical assistance, training and
            provision of essential equipment to develop RAC's
            ability to perform adequate technical and financial
            management of basic urban services (stormwater drainage
            network maintenance, garbage collection and service vehicle
            maintenance); and (iii) rehabilitation of existing and
            construction of new stormwater drainage networks to improve
            city-wide environmental conditions.

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project will strengthen the
            operational capacity of Central and Local Government
            institutions responsible for urban development planning and
            urban service management in Conakry. To this effect, the
            project will fund: (i) technical assistance, training and
            provision of essential equipment to enhance The Ministry of
            Construction, Housing, Urban Planning and Domain
            (MCHUD)'s and the Conakry Administrative Region
            (RAC)'s capacity to plan, coordinate and control urban
            development in the Greater Conakry area; (ii) technical
            assistance, training and provision of essential equipment to
            develop RAC's ability to perform adequate technical and
            financial management of basic urban services (stormwater
            drainage network maintenance, garbage collection and service
            vehicle maintenance); and (iii) rehabilitation of existing
            and construction of new stormwater drainage networks to
            improve city-wide environmental conditions.
